summary: The Sarvis Creek Wilderness Completion Act aims to amend the Colorado Wilderness Act of 1993. It proposes adding approximately 6,817 acres of land within the Routt National Forest to the Sarvis Creek Wilderness. The bill defines the new land area (Sarvis Creek Wilderness Addition), the Secretary's role, and outlines provisions for tribal rights, traditional uses, and management activities regarding fire, insects, and diseases. This includes allowing the Secretary to carry out necessary activities for control of fire, insects and diseases in the wilderness addition.
